choice1: The dad in this makes me want to start my own cult. Anything available to give me tips on the occult lore for that?
choice2: Confining and controlling someone is a pretty good way of showing you care, right? I'm in the mood for a love story next...
choice3: More weird dental hijinks, please! Got anything with a pedophile dentist in it?

choice1: I think I need a linguist to help me understand all those thick fake Boston accents!
choice2: Lighthouses are cool, but what really turns me on is windmills...
choice3: More seaside antics, but fewer rats please!

choice1: Wow, not a lot of women in that film. Got anything with Sophia Loren in it to clear the palate?
choice2: Too dry and dusty for me. Got anything in a damper setting?
choice3: I wish I were drinking a milkshake in Paris right now...

choice1: Landlords suck! You can't get a landlord much worse than the one in this movie, right? I mean, right?
choice2: This was very loosely based on an opera set in Paris, and moved to New York, right? Got anything where we go the other direction and take a hard-boiled novel in the U.S. and set it in Paris with some of the genders flipped?
choice3: I love movies about blood-borne illnesses. Show me more!

choice1: Got anything else produced by Roger Corman? He seems to pick winners!
choice2: If Mama Ramone gave birth to another one, what should she name him? Is Alphonse too provincial? Should she call him Ghislain instead? Let's reason this out.
choice3: A Heroic Life) There's no way some dudes as funny looking as the Ramones would have gorgeous women swooning over them in real life, right? Right?

choice1: Wow, poor people have it rough. How does it compare to having a disability though?
choice2: Not bad, but got anything with actual parasites in it?
choice3: That kid was pretty stealthy! Bet his skills could have been applied pretty well in wartime...

choice1: So who would win in a fight--a detachment of dismounted Cossacks or an equal number of grizzly bears?
choice2: Okay, so now I have that "In the Navy" song by the Village People stuck in my head. Might as well roll with the homoeroticism...
choice3: My attention span is still shot. Got anything else relatively short, preferably in black and white?

choice1: "Springtime for Hitler" is over. Is it hockey season yet?
choice2: Fraud is kind of old fashioned for me. Show me the newest innovations in organ harvesting instead!
choice3: I think that Bialystock was onto something. Even some younger women can agree there's something appealing about older women!

choice1: It's probably best not to gamble with your health with untested treatments--or to gamble much at all, for that matter!
choice2: Sad that most people don't know, don't show, or don't care what's going on with mutagenic surgical technology these days...
choice3: Wow, it's interesting how much a motorcycle accident can really mess someone up...

choice1: Making a film is probably easy if no one is deliberately trying to make it tricky for you, right?
choice2: ...And it's nice to see how calm and collected filmmakers can be in the face of hardship!
choice3: I suppose it's easier making a film than a blimp!

choice1: Bet it would be easier to get that ship through the jungle if someone only had a steamroller!
choice2: At least no one drowned in those rapids. Safe boating is no accident!
choice3: That was good but kind of long. Got anything by the same director, but maybe shorter?

choice1: I'd love for someone to make a Klaus Kinski biopic with some old He-Man dolls. Got anything to tide me over until that happens?
choice2: Good lord, what bit Klaus Kinski to make him such a nutcase?
choice3: I love Kinski's energy and impulsiveness. Too bad he never channeled that into being a federal agent and catching counterfeiters!

choice1: The stocking scene was weirdly hot for something this early. I'm in the mood to watch some cabaret dancers now...
choice2: Call me a monster, but I kinda laughed at the part where the little kid got shot!
choice3: At the risk of sounding like a punk, FUCK the bourgeois virtues and outdated sexual mores of our society!

choice1: This movie gives me the strange urge to watch 1990s hood films and early surrealist films in an endless loop for some reason!
choice2: This had some pretty intense imagery in it. Got anything a little lighter? You know...for kids!
choice3: Too much eyeball trauma! You know who's a little easier on the eyes--Alain Delon!

choice1: The chicken hypnotizer was pretty cool. So what happens if you hypnotize actors instead of poultry?
choice2: I'm a sucker for true stories with unhappy endings. Got anything like that where the actors are a bit more...plasti?
choice3: Based on my viewing of this film, the Great and Powerful AI Algorithm thinks I would enjoy more movies about the fragility of innocence in the face of a complex and sometimes deceptive world!

choice1: Dracula is fine, but what really scares me is babbling zombies in a snowstorm!
choice2: The count was looking pretty pale and sickly. I bet a trip to Rio would do him some good!
choice3: I love the part where the count looks at the crucifix and tells Jesus, "Do your early stuff!" Oh wait, that was a different film...

choice1: Not enough strong female characters in this one. I want to see something where the women wear the pants!
choice2: Meh. Needs more strippers!
choice3: I do have a soft-spot for films that feature a pathetic man-child though...

choice1: I greatly prefer the sitar to the cello...
choice2: It just goes to show that sometimes two spouses are better than one!
choice3: That was alright, but now I'm in the mood for some hot girl-on-girl scissoring action!

choice1: Watching kinky stuff in your formative years can certainly warp your sexuality. Speaking of which...got any horror films with lots of full frontal nudity?
choice2: Nothing takes the sting out of corporal punishment like chasing it with some THC!
choice3: That kid should have tried bringing Dottie a charlotte russe cake with whipped cream instead of his amateurish drawings if he really wanted to get her attention!

choice1: I know I should probably watch The Hudsucker Proxy next, but we'll put that off for awhile. Show me something with weird little dwarves instead!
choice2: Some of that jive talk was difficult for me to understand. Got anything where the characters are from somewhere people talk normal, like Boston?
choice3: Selling out is the worst thing someone can do. Stay bohemian! Fuck The Man!

choice1: Such beautiful scenery. Makes me want to watch something where people vomit parasites that turn other people into rapists!
choice2: Fata Morgana would be a great name for a soap opera character!
choice3: A bit dry for me. Got anything in a damper setting?

choice1: "Fishy fishy in the brook, Daddy caught you, now you're a hook-er!"
choice2: I feel like I should chase this with a doomed love story, but I'm going to need to ease into it with some gruesome atomic bomb aftermath footage!
choice3: Poor Billy never had a chance. I bet joining the army and some dietary changes would have cured what ailed him!

choice1: Drag racing is fun to watch, but you know what else is a drag? Wittgenstein's views about the limits of language!
choice2: Got anything with more booze/tobacco/dope/pussy/cars? Feel free to throw in some guns as well!
choice3: Those racers must keep their guardian angels pretty busy!

choice1: Poor Carol. She just needed some good-looking guy like Alain Delon to sweep her off her feet.
choice2: ...or maybe two good-looking guys!
choice3: ...or maybe just some pudgy Russian dude with a port-wine stain on his head!

choice1: I think it's safe to say a lot of Dylan's cynicism came from being a product of the atomic age!
choice2: He definitely changed his demeanor and appearance over the course of his career!
choice3: "Sleep? aint sleepin'... Sleep's for dreamers. I haven't slept in thirty days, man. Takes a lot of medicine to keep up this pace."

choice1: A film about dirty cops is just screaming for someone to make a stage play out of it. Didn't someone do that with Serpico?
choice2: Nicolas Cage's quiet and understated performance in this makes me want to watch something by Cate Blanchett.
choice3: And the obvious Freudian aspects put me in the mood for something based on Oedipus Rex.

choice1: Whether it's Bushido or the Bible, a man's gotta have a code!
choice2: The samurai may be all gone, but Western Civilization's not looking so hot itself.
choice3: Enough with the samurai cop stuff. Time for a good chick-flick!

choice1: Alcoholic cops are almost as bad as alcoholic pilots!
choice2: Just the right level of lurid...but could we ramp up the sincerity?
choice3: This is fine, but needs more madrigals!

choice1: It's fun getting a look at all the drama behind the scenes when films are being made!
choice2: Good to see talented people with ambition. Sad to think how many just hang out getting drunk around parking lots...
choice3: How about something with a few more crimes but less of the filmmaking...

choice1: That poor kid never stood a chance at being chaste with Sophia Loren across the way from him. I wonder if nuns have it any easier...
choice2: Enough pretty Italians. Show me some pre-meltdown Elon Musk bragging about how he's going to send people to Mars!
choice3: I have no doubt that Sophia Loren would fill out a bikini nicely...

choice1: Sometimes getting away for a bit on holiday is all it takes to change your life!
choice2: Barring that, you could just stay home and look at postcards...
choice3: Or become a cat burglar. Probably a more interesting career path than being a domestic servant!

choice1: Balzac was lucky to be around French-speaking people, considering that his name sounds like ball-sack in English. Speaking of which, got any French films that end on untranslatable puns?
choice2: I like all the artist model nudity, but what would be really cool is if someone read some feminist Marxist texts to accompany it!
choice3: Okay, the French had some pretty good sculptors, but how are they at engineering?

choice1: Towers next to rivers are fine. But lighthouses next to the ocean are even cooler!
choice2: Sure, the French can build towers out of wrought iron. But can they build titties out of sand?
choice3: This movie makes civil engineers look pretty glamorous. Got anything that does the same for concierges?

choice1: Joan's army was tough, but could they take on an actual full-sized Spanish windmill?
choice2: Joan was a great warrior and leader, but could she properly bread a veal cutlet?
choice3: Just goes to show that sometimes good things happen if you put someone young and inexperienced in charge of things!

choice1: Gotta admit I'm a sucker for a film with a funny-looking protagonist.
choice2: But sometimes it's great when the very gay director just uses the prettiest dude he could find!
choice3: Actually, I kinda feel like just putting a couple of Serge Gainsbourg albums on and listening to those for a few hours. Got any silent films I could watch while I do that?

choice1: Some boys are into grizzly bears. And some will nearly burn their houses down building a Balzac shrine in their bedroom. Consider me the latter type!
choice2: So, ladies, would you rather drink arsenic or get ripped to shreds by a bear? I'd probably go with the arsenic, myself.
choice3: At least a bear would be a nice distraction from awaiting scary medical test results...

choice1: Well, when the army sucks, maybe deserting is a better option.
choice2: Downer ending, but he would have been facing capital punishment anyway.
choice3: That pondside murder-suicide would have made great fodder for a television tabloid show, especially if someone showed up to film it live!

choice1: I'm more of a homebody, myself, aside from occasionally running short errands. And I work from home...
choice2: Why be a visitor to the moon when you can go to Africa and overthrow a king?
choice3: Flying around in planes and rockets is nice, but don't neglect your wife!

choice1: Bet those witches could put on a pretty bitchin' fireworks display if they started going stir crazy...
choice2: I've heard witches kill babies, but Cossacks will do the same thing if given a chance.
choice3: I guess burning witches is fine if you don't have the option of tossing them in a volcano.

choice1: A slender gal like Karen would have made an awesome cat burglar!
choice2: A little too skinny for sex work though.
choice3: Let's see something different. Barbie dolls are for babies...

choice1: At least those prisoners had each other to keep themselves entertained. Solitary confinement can be pretty rough on a young man.
choice2: The kid flying away reminded me of Peter Pan. Let's watch that next--or the closest thing to it that you have, I guess...
choice3: The pastoral scenes were nice, but those juvenile delinquents would be better suited for adventures in the wild if they had been doing boy scouting instead of committing crimes!

choice1: Too lighthearted! Show me something with more misery, preferably in a rural setting--with some possible incest thrown in!
choice2: Well, everything around that poor guy that could go wrong did go wrong. That'd be a disaster if he were a film director!
choice3: Holidays are for the bourgeoisie! No time for that nonsense until after the Revolution comes!

choice1: Lots of adventures to be had when traveling! Even a short getaway can be packed with action and (mis)adventures!
choice2: I'm a bigger fan of Munchhausen sydrome by proxy. Got anything with a baby in it?
choice3: When you have to choose between the truth and the legend, choose the legend!

choice1: I love films with a slash in the title! Show me more!
choice2: Oz is boring. Let's go bowling!
choice3: Let's follow the yellow brick road...and see if any cops tail us!

choice1: Wow, conditions in that place weren't much better than in a POW camp!
choice2: Despite the name, this didn't have any actual titties in it...
choice3: Pretty good talent show considering it was put on by nothing but inmates and staff. Some people can do great work when challenged by such limitations I guess...

choice1: This film taught me that stealing bicycles is rad! Show me some more fun activities for juvenile delinquents!
choice2: Antonio may have failed at being a provider for his wife and a role model for their son, but at least he's less disappointing than Frankenstein's monster!
choice3: Good thing they were in Italy and not Texas. There would have been no mercy, and some hangin' judge would have thrown the book at him...

choice1: Any good social worker can tell you that's not a good environment for a baby. He'll be lucky if he doesn't grow up to end up on death row!
choice2: Adult babies are pretty transgressive, but I'm really in the mood for developmentally disabled porn star rapists!
choice3: Isn't it a bit more normal for the person acting as babysitter to run off with the dad, not the kid?

choice1: Enough workers, let's see how the upper class live...
choice2: This would be more exciting with an alien invasion!
choice3: Moscow's pretty, but it isn't as pretty as the mountains...

choice1: Russians versus Nazis is fun, but what I'm really in the mood for is Rockers versus Mods.
choice2: Poor Ivan never got to see much of the world.
choice3: Very tragic! Good thing children are a renewable resource.

choice1: More dust, less goo please!
choice2: And maybe some dancing chickens!
choice3: Gross, but honestly I've seen much worse on social media lately!

choice1: The only way this could be cheesier is if they broke the fourth wall...
choice2: Dracula's groupies were pretty hot, but I wonder how they compare to women in thrall to the Ramones?
choice3: Udo Kier was probably a lot easier to work with when playing Dracula than Klaus Kinski was...

choice1: Baron von Frankenstein had some pretty ambitious ideas. I love a man with a plan!
choice2: It's always a good idea to keep it in the family I guess...
choice3: That Igor scene was pretty traumatic. If you got anything else like that to sit through, let's just get it out of the way now.

choice1: Not enough tribbles! Could we maybe get something with penguins in it instead?
choice2: Actually I want to see all the tribbles! Give me something completely wacky to watch...
choice3: I thought this was going to be the one with the whales! Can I at least have something with a shark in it next?

choice1: The eternal dilemma: I can't decide if I'm more in the mood for Jean Cocteau now...
choice2: ...or Adam Sandler!
choice3: Cats are great at always landing on their feet. Wonder how they'd be on skis?

choice1: Enough of Spain. Let's check in on Kenya and Tanzania!
choice2: Cervantes is cool, but I'm a bigger fan of Lewis Carroll. Let's go down the rabbit hole...and maybe to a haunted house!
choice3: Okay, here's a niche request. Got any movies where I can watch two guys move a bunch of rocks around?

choice1: That meat looked really unappetizing. I'd mutiny if someone tried to feed me that stuff...
choice2: Cannibalism is but a mirage.
choice3: I'm ready for something a bit more Shakespearean!

choice1: I wonder what Klaus Kinski was like as a baby...
choice2: I want an army of Amazons to stage theater productions with, but I'd settle for an army of asylum inmates instead.
choice3: An army of Amazons would be great, but an army of sassy flying monkeys would be even better!

choice1: That cop could have been worse I guess...
choice2: Less cops, more robots!
choice3: Less heists, more cannibalism!

choice1: Not sure if Stroszek or his friends had any cheerleader background, but a performing chicken could make a pretty good mascot!
choice2: Maybe Bruno would have fared better in the Foreign Legion.
choice3: Why rob a grocery store when you can get a good honest job in a slaughterhouse?

choice1: A talking cat beats a precocious genius child any time...you never age out of being a talking cat!
choice2: Too much Judaism! Give me something WASPier.
choice3: Let's check in on a butcher shop--preferably kosher or halal...

choice1: "I loved it!"
choice2: "It was great!"
choice3: "I'm going to see it again and again!"

choice1: Those were great, but I think I need something different. How about a live-action cartoon?
choice2: Or maybe a musical interlude?
choice3: More short films by oddball directors, please!

choice1: Well that was bleak. I'd love to shut my brain off and just watch some exploding cannibal aliens for awhile.
choice2: I don't mind a little darkness, but let's make it noir-flavored this time!
choice3: Got anything with Nicole Kidman in it? Preferably doing some imperialism?

choice1: Maybe Greek tragedies are a bit much for young people to watch in their formative years. At most they should be watching spicy episodes of "I Love Lucy"...
choice2: Forget the pizza. He should have asked for a plane.
choice3: That kid got a bit too much into Greek tragedy. But at least he wasn't some goddamn weeaboo!

choice1: Less aliens, more nuns!
choice2: I can think of another man who came down from the Heavens to deliver a message to the people of this world...
choice3: That diving stuff was pretty cool. Makes me wonder how well dogs are able to swim...

choice1: Are we sure that poor guy didn't have any brain worms causing him to act like that?
choice2: These guys would have found more exciting ways to stay entertained in the hood. Just sayin'.
choice3: If you're prone to being stir crazy, stay away from military deployments and nunneries!

choice1: I heard a rumor that there's some version of King Lear directed by Godard. That sounds badass!
choice2: Do green ants dream of electric sheep?
choice3: Aussie accents are too hard to understand. Could I get some fake-Boston accents instead?

choice1: I hate seeing people locked up unjustly...
choice2: Whether it's a prison camp or a boy scout camp, sometimes you just need to get away...
choice3: Wouldn't it have been safer to tunnel out of the camp?

choice1: I'm glad Dieter got out. I only hope someone can rescue southeast Asia from imperialism!
choice2: Too many Herzog movies lately. I'm ready for some Martin Scorsese!
choice3: The jungle looks scary but at least there aren't any bears!

choice1: Looking in on those weirdos was upsetting. Makes me want to take a nice relaxing bath, maybe with one of my scuba toys!
choice2: Dracula's more sordid killings would be interesting to re-enact!
choice3: I was going to suggest The Thin Blue Line after this, but it's not currently available in my region. Let's watch some Nazi-era fantasy instead!

choice1: This plotline wasn't exactly written by Balzac. Just sayin'.
choice2: Amateur actors doing micro-theater imitating people's dead loved ones sounds like a guaranteed sure-fire way to lose money, but you never know...
choice3: I can't tell if those actors were part of a business or part of a cult...

choice1: I bet some kinky boots would have gotten that girl some more social media followers...
choice2: ...as long as she didn't go and say something stupid and anti-semitic!
choice3: I love the suspense combined with an anti-climax. Could I get something suspenseful and a little more traditional Hitchcockian, please?

choice1: I read that Babadook book too, but he never pestered me. Maybe he got stuck in traffic...
choice2: Some buddhists believe that everyone is reincarnated as a Babadook eventually!
choice3: Single parenting looks rough, so it's probably good to have a spare dude around in case things go bad with the first one!

choice1: The right footwear can attract a young woman a better class of suitor...
choice2: You know what pairs well with red boots? A red beret!
choice3: If that shoe factory does well enough, they should expand operations...to the moon!

choice1: Everyone needs a good father figure...and you can do worse than a firefighter!
choice2: Even carfuckers don't deserve the death penalty!
choice3: I heard there was a lot of gender-bending in ancient Greek theater.

choice1: I wonder how much those cool chairs would go for at auction...
choice2: I've hard that high fructose corn syrup does wonders for digestion!
choice3: Cronenberg movies always put me in the mood for uncomfortable sex combined with viruses and parasites. Got anything to indulge me?

choice1: Polyandry, drunken debauchery, Lee Marvin and Clint Eastwood singing? I need an alien to make sense of this stuff...
choice2: So do Lee Marvin and Clint Eastwood do ballet as well?
choice3: When I saw Lee Marvin was in this, I was expecting a little more...war movie action? Could we get something more like that?

choice1: This wasn't even close to being a Dogme 95 film!
choice2: Less singing, more dancing please!
choice3: Lots of drunken sailors in Jacques Brel's best songs...

choice1: Animated flappers are so outdated. I want to see some old people humping trash cans!
choice2: Short hair is a pretty good look on women though. Especially when they go full tomboy!
choice3: I wonder if Betty Boop had a difficult childhood...

choice1: God wouldn't like communists and intellectuals!
choice2: Did Jacques Brel have any songs about televangelists?
choice3: I have a soft spot for deranged old men!

choice1: Are there any conspiracy theories about ski jumpers?
choice2: I hate winter sports. I'd rather find a way to have adventures in front of my computer screen!
choice3: Even bowling is more exciting than skiing!

choice1: You don't have to be strong to swindle war widows out of their pensions!
choice2: I love feats of strength. Got anything with arm-wrestling in it?
choice3: So what happens if you don't have a brawny older brother to stop people from bullying you?

choice1: I heard that the tie-breaker for this competition is a dance-off!
choice2: Being a hit with the ladies can be fun AND profitable!
choice3: Having a great smile is one thing, but what women really love is a fast car!

choice1: Trekking through the desert is great, but haunted houses are more my speed.
choice2: I bet Count Dracula would have given her a royal welcome!
choice3: All this imperialism just makes me want to put my fist through a Union Jack.

choice1: All this ecoterrorism was a good warmup. I think I'm ready for some full-on genocide!
choice2: Actually let's back down a bit and watch some colorful parades and costumes and musicians instead.
choice3: Sex work is probably a little safer than dealing with eco-terrorists, but not by much...

choice1: I'd rather be in Paris than stranded in the jungle.
choice2: This needed more spankings.
choice3: If you're lost in the jungle, a machete would be a pretty handy tool. But if it's in the wrong hands...

choice1: This seems like something spiritual enough to inspire someone to pursue a life of adventurous travel!
choice2: Life is suffering, and the pleasures of the moment can lead to pain, and so the cycle continues...
choice3: Less Buddha, more Bushido please!

choice1: Got anything with a longer title?
choice2: Modern technology all just seems like witchcraft to me!
choice3: No actual Tenenbaums were interviewed for this documentary, but some of those interviewees had reputations that aged like milk.

choice1: Those kids were pretty young, but the Army can be a pretty grand adventure if you're old enough to enjoy it and bring back souvenirs!
choice2: Bet Hitchcock could have made a pretty suspenseful film about child soldiers...
choice3: Kids should be learning to play musical instruments at that age, not shooting rifles!

choice1: Antarctica would be even cooler with sand-worms...
choice2: Being trapped in a POW camp in Antarctica would be awful. Southeast Asia would be bad enough!
choice3: Gambling would be a pretty good way to waste time when faced with those cold endless nights!

choice1: Those doctors are lucky to get a Herzog documentary immortalizing them, but a Bob Dylan song would have been even better!
choice2: What's the point of flying around like that if you're not even going to do any crimes?
choice3: Bet they see some interesting parasites in that part of the world! But things can be just as bad in Canada...

choice1: Bet the thin air would make it hard being a high-altitude auctioneer!
choice2: Chucking wood is great exercise, actually. A lot more fun than hauling rocks!
choice3: I hate when people read poetry too fast. No need to rush...

choice1: Too bad those kids aren't in some soap opera universe, where even decapitations can be overcome and brain transplants can be performed in restaurants!
choice2: This is some bleak-ass Herzog. I need something different. Play me some Dylan instead.
choice3: Actually I'm not done being depressed. Show me how bad nuns used to have it!

choice1: If you pray hard enough, you'll never need an umbrella to stay safe and dry!
choice2: I bet Huie would have plenty to say about bad parenting...
choice3: Thoughts and prayers are great, but having actual doctors show up to help people is even better.

choice1: So how does homosexuality work at high altitudes?
choice2: Are there stray cats in those mountains? I heard those can be really dangerous!
choice3: Those mountains are pretty scenic. They'd look great on postcards!

choice1: Did Bruce ever make it to any futuristic robot cities?
choice2: I bet he never ran across any cannibal aliens either!
choice3: Forget dinosaur skins...I want an airplane! Vroom vroom!

choice1: Let's see some more Herzog...but throw in some Klaus Kinski to make it spicy!
choice2: Actually scratch that, time for some Godard...
choice3: I changed my mind. Got anything with Madonna in it?

choice1: Real life criminals are sad, bleak, and often a bit boring. Let's see something a little more noir-influenced!
choice2: Why not just send death row prisoners off to life in prison in Antarctica instead?
choice3: This documentary would have benefited from a catchy theme song.

choice1: I love a good festival. Let's do Carnival in Rio next!
choice2: Actually I need a break from color. Got any chiaroscuro for me?
choice3: I can't think of anything better to chase all these colorful Indian festivities with than a Holocaust documentary!

choice1: I love seeing people get that excited about aircraft!
choice2: Wait...there's a King Lear version that's directed by Godard AND has Norman Mailer in it as Lear? Why have I not heard of this?
choice3: Oh the humanity! I bet Balzac or Flaubert would have a field day making a story about these guys...

choice1: I wish we could ship some of our more obnoxious pundits and tech bro messiahs off to Siberia!
choice2: Siberia is a bit remote. Maybe just a convent in the Himalayas.
choice3: Those pieds-noirs who fled Algeria were definitely NOT happy people.

choice1: As with Vissarion, Rasputin, or any other Russian mystics, beweare of a Holy Whore!
choice2: I'm ready to sink in my couch and watch a few hours of Sergio Leone now.
choice3: Actually, got anything with dirty cops but without Harvey Keitel?

choice1: Madrigals are nice, but I'm ready for a full concert.
choice2: Actually I could use some Owen Wilson about now to clear the palate. Luke can come along too I guess...
choice3: Herzog docs often put me in the mood for Godard not-quite documentaries. Got anything that will thrill me?

choice1: So does King of New York outrank President of Russia?
choice2: Gorbachev did wonders ushering in the declining Soviet Union to a new era. Wonder what he could have done for an ailing rave venue in Manchester?
choice3: No more godless communists, please. Show me a real man of God!

choice1: Blood is thicker than water, but is it thicker than lava?
choice2: In the grand scheme of things, getting killed by a volcano is pretty fucking punk!
choice3: If lava flows over your shoes, they may be red for a moment, but not for very long!

choice1: How about some more Herzog, but less short and more smiley!
choice2: Or maybe a break from Herzog is in order. Sterling Hayden in a heist film might clear the palate a bit.
choice3: Or we could split the difference and watch some weirdos filming themselves meticulously recreating crime scenes for unspecified reasons!

choice1: I'm sad this didn't have a catchier theme song.
choice2: This film is so late seventies. Got anything 1980s flavored? Bonus points if it reminds me of Miami Vice!
choice3: "I hate the way your muscles glisten as you bury people's pets..."

choice1: Seeing all the turkeys makes me want to see something at least partially set in Turkey!
choice2: Bet you could shoot a lot of turkeys from an airship!
choice3: Could I get close to the water but far, far away from the Florida panhandle, please?

choice1: The Babadook was framed!
choice2: A talking cat would be a great alibi witness!
choice3: Great documentary, but needs more deranged suicidal penguins!

choice1: Lesson twelve: don't go into a hotel room alone with Colonel Kurtz and a stick of butter!
choice2: Eleven concepts is a lot to keep track of. I think I could handle five at most!
choice3: Someone needs to remake this with a bunch of G.I. Joe dolls...

choice1: Yeah, I'm going to need a chick flick after this one.
choice2: I'd love to see a sequel where Dith Pran teams up with some crusty old lawman to bring Pol Pot to the Hague, dead or alive!
choice3: Pol Pot sucked, but let's check in on some of the rich elitist pricks that inspired his campaign of terror.

choice1: I wonder if there's some sort of merit badge for growing your own corn...
choice2: Is early Godard this corny?
choice3: Only terrible parents would feed all this processed food garbage to their children!

choice1: Sometimes spying on women through peepholes in the wall isn't the worst thing a person can do.
choice2: Madonna has been around long enough where she's considered nostalgia. Show me some stuff by THE material girl!
choice3: I miss the old days when Coca-Cola still had real sugar in it instead of corn syrup...

choice1: Lots of very tasteful and understated fashion choices in this movie! Show me more!
choice2: More color!
choice3: I SAID MORE COLOR!

choice1: Once upon a time in America...we had a team that could beat the USSR! Tell me more about the good old days, Grandpa!
choice2: So...is there a special cemetery for hockey players?
choice3: Hockey is a nice manly sport! I bet it's a good way of curing the gay!

choice1: That was a nice interlude, but I guess we can go back to the world of scheming yuppie scum!
choice2: Cartoon Kim Basinger is pretty hot, but she's got nothing on flesh-and-blood Pam Grier!
choice3: Too bad Bruce Chatwin never made it to the Cool World in all his nomadic wanderings...

choice1: Just goes to show that it's always best to consult your concierge about travel times when setting an itinerary!
choice2: A bit too epic for me. Got anything with smaller stakes?
choice3: Nicely apocalyptic, but I prefer my apocalypses with a side of radioactive pteranodons. What's the closest thing you've got for me?

choice1: Murdering people with swords or machetes is kind of an odd thing to do in our modern world...
choice2: Anyone who runs a hotel can't be all bad, I guess...
choice3: Are there deserts in Rwanda? My geography is pretty bad...

choice1: As the name suggests, that was pretty loud and chaotic. Bob Ross is a bit more my speed...
choice2: What have we learned? Always be honest with your financial paperwork. White collar crime can get you into trouble!
choice3: Knowing martial arts is good for young ladies dating strangers. You never know when you may need to defend yourself!

choice1: More sand please!
choice2: Jodorowsky could probably do a pretty good job telling something a little more focused than Dune, like the adventures of Baron Munchhausen!
choice3: On the other hand, I really do NOT want to see Jodorowsky adapting anything by Elmore Leonard!

choice1: Those poor pooches were facing a pretty hopeless situation. Kinda reminds me of the whole Kobayashi Maru thing from a certain sci-fi series from the 1960s...
choice2: I bet a clever advertiser could figure out some brilliant way to use experimental test animals to sell acne medicine
choice3: It's a rough world for a dog. Having a good human companion is almost as important as it is for a boy to have a good father figure...

choice1: One confident young woman bossing two men with very different personalities around is an interesting dynamic...
choice2: Meh, needs more aliens.
choice3: Vengeance can be a pretty powerful motivator!

choice1: We're off to meet the wizard, the wonderful wizard of the Kremlin!
choice2: I wonder what the rehearsals looked like when The Wiz was still in development before it hit the stage...
choice3: It's good to be The Wiz, but everybody's gunning for you, especially when there's a poppy epidemic...

choice1: Drug debts can sure get you in a mess if you're not careful!
choice2: This movie was good, but decidedly lacking i horny, squabbling nuns!
choice3: If you're going to do crimes, it's best to keep things within the family!

choice1: Los Angeles seems like a fast-paced, violent place. Florida is more my speed!
choice2: Living on the edge in Los Angeles can be stressful, but is it really worse than middle school?
choice3: Would you rather burn to death or go to prison? Well, what if it was a really horny prison?

choice1: Some people handle stress very, very poorly!
choice2: I bet women can handle stress a bit better than...that!
choice3: Uh, let's check back in on the criminals. They gotta be better behaved than the cops!

choice1: The best thing about being King of New York is not having to pay rent!
choice2: Frank may have been a drug kingpin, but at least he wasn't a slimy backstabbing yuppie!
choice3: I'd rather get laid in Hiroshima than rule in New York!

choice1: I prefer my gangstas many shades whiter and with thick Boston accents, thank you very much!
choice2: There's nothing gangsta about stabbing some poor weird feral kid.
choice3: All this toxic masculinity! Couldn't they just have a beauty contest instead?

choice1: Dawn Weiner would probably have been more popular if she could just learn to shut up and be pretty...
choice2: Poor Dawn. At least she didn't have any creeps stalking and mimicking her...
choice3: Hooking up with other outsider weirdos probably would have been good for her. Plus I bet she'd be good at splicing film with those long fingers.

choice1: Whether you're a gangsta in South Central or some idiot rave kid in Manchester trying to make an album, stay away from crack!
choice2: I do love films that have a tragic shootout at the end!
choice3: This movie gives me the strange urge to watch 1990s hood films and early surrealist films in an endless loop for some reason!

choice1: Alcohol and drugs can be dangerous. One minute you've got a good buzz, and then later you wake up hungover and you've bought something stupid at auction...like a wife!
choice2: I've heard some strains of weed can make a person more creative...
choice3: I've also heard marijuana can be good for digestion. Is there any furniture that has the same effect?

choice1: If teaching kids dance doesn't pan out, she could always get a job in a pet cemetery!
choice2: Too bad for Frances that someone already took the one job in Paris that was available for experimental dancers/choreographers...
choice3: The retro black and white made me feel like I was watching a French New Wave film!

choice1: Getting out of poverty in Watts seems almost as hard as escaping a POW camp!
choice2: Interesting peek at the lives of African Americans in Watts. Let's see what things were like for LGBT people in Tokyo in the 1960s next!
choice3: Or we could look in on a small theater company instead...

choice1: I can see why a young person might want to move away from a place like Muncie to try their luck in the city!
choice2: Sometimes putting a new person with radical ideas in charge can work out well, whether you want it to or not!
choice3: I know I should probably watch Putney Swope next, but for the moment at least let's listen to some gypsy jazz!

choice1: Sadly this isn't even close to passing the Bechdel test. Show me something featuring female friendship!
choice2: A bit disappointed--I thought this was going to be the animated one!
choice3: Got anything else German but a bit noisier and more modern?

choice1: So what would have happened if she had just clicked those red shoes together a couple of times while saying "There's no place like home?"
choice2: I don't often say this, but...less ballet, more genocide, please!
choice3: Don't ask me why, but I think a low-budget Psycho ripoff would be a nice chaser for this!

choice1: Someone should have asked those nuns their opinions on current events!
choice2: Those nuns would have more time to fool around if they could read their daily prayers a bit faster!
choice3: It felt a bit claustrophobic in that abbey. Show me something where the characters travel a bit more widely!

choice1: That guy would be a very poor maker of documentaries about women!
choice2: He needed to be less of a creep and maybe hit the gym.
choice3: I'm fine with a bit of horror, but I prefer haunted houses to slasher flicks!

choice1: I feel bad for whoever has to clean up all that parasite vomit orgy mess!
choice2: Sometimes people don't even need some disgusting parasite to make them run around fucking each other, though they might be more surreptitious about it if they aren't infected!
choice3: Less body horror, more Cold War paranoia!

choice1: Rich people suck! Show me some virtuous poverty instead!
choice2: This film certainly had some questionable medical practices in it...
choice3: Robert Pattinson is pretty, but is he Antonio Banderas pretty?

choice1: Bond traders are assholes. I'll take a good civil engineer over ten of those every day!
choice2: Even sailors are more tolerable than yuppies!
choice3: Which is scarier--the south Bronx, or rural Canada during a snowstorm?

choice1: Why travel the world when you can have adventures on social media in your own bedroom?
choice2: Travel sucks. If there's one benefit to being handicapped, it's that no one minds if you're a homebody!
choice3: I guess age gap relationships are fine as long as no one is secretly related!

choice1: Show me more tense, stressed-out women please!
choice2: If you have two hours to kill, don't watch a Rivette film. Most of them clock in around three hours or more!
choice3: A Talking Heads concert is just the right length if you have some time to kill in the evening.

choice1: Singing for ninety minutes is one thing. Could they keep it up for almost thirteen hours straight though?
choice2: I heard Christopher Walken has a musical theater background. Let's watch one of his films next!
choice3: Enough prancing around by the seaside. Let's head back to Paris!

choice1: I'm not sure what I want to watch for the next one. You pick!
choice2: No, seriously. I'll watch whatever.
choice3: I can't decide and I always have to pick. You pick the next one!

choice1: Feeling the gay here. Send me over the rainbow, baby!
choice2: Um...got anything a little less gay?
choice3: Or at least with more gore?

choice1: Bad parenting leads to bad outcomes. Your kid could end up in a mental hospital!
choice2: Or worse, a philosopher!
choice3: Or if it's a girl, she could end up swinging on a pole or being an artist model or something!

choice1: That kid needs some better hobbies. Nothing too creepy or weird though...
choice2: That poor Antoine will never amount to anything. I certainly don't see him becoming a doctor or pilot or anything useful...
choice3: Poor kid. Get ready though, there's plenty of heartbreak to be had even when you grow up and get married!

choice1: How about instead of having two boyfriends, you just have one but he's a vampire?
choice2: Love the song in this, but bet she'd be even more of a hit with the guys if her voice was a bit squeakier and her looks a bit more flapper-ish...
choice3: Jules and Jim and Catherine were pretty connected, maybe overly so...

choice1: Sometimes it's fine to be a bit sloppier than Hitchcock...
choice2: Did Hitchcock ever hypnotize his actors?
choice3: I have pretty bad vertigo myself, so even getting on the roof of a convenience store would be pretty suspenseful!

choice1: Who needs a piano player when you can dance to the jukebox?
choice2: I was waiting for some rich handsome man like Alain Delon to sweep her away, but this is not Pretty Woman.
choice3: I wonder how many girls have turned tricks for Ramones tix.

choice1: Pretty fancy place they were living in--anything else to watch for decorating ideas?
choice2: I save my contempt for rich people getting prostate exams in limousines.
choice3: Having to suffer someone's contempt is bad, but at least it's not death row!

choice1: Dawn Weiner will be first against the wall when the revolution comes. Down with the Weiner Dog!
choice2: So is Serge Gainsbourg considered Gainsbourgeois?
choice3: All those little red books put me in the mood for some cranberry juice!

choice1: I'm going to have to go find something to listen to so I can keep that damn theme song from getting stuck ib my head. Thanks, Fallout New Vegas! You pick the next one!
choice2: I'd love to watch something with more crabs in it...
choice3: When women wear the pants, they get to set the Rules of the Game!

choice1: Ski-jumping over asphalt would be a terrible idea!
choice2: I bet Sterling Hayden was better behaved on set than KlausKinski!
choice3: Every heist team needs a talking cat!

choice1: Needs more Madonna.
choice2: That "Rififi" song was kind of a banger, but Belle and Sebastian is more my speed...
choice3: Or maybe some gangsta rap would be better!

choice1: Bob the Gambler has a nice ring to it. Much better than being known as Bob the Pervert or Bob the Jew.
choice2: Great vibe, but would be even greater with some Cold War paranoia thrown in!
choice3: Bob wasn't cut out for heists. Maybe he'd be a better ad-man...

choice1: No one likes a rat. Unless you're from Baltimore!
choice2: Snitches get stitches...but not in the eyeball!
choice3: Enough hard-boiled noir stuff. Give me a feel-good Adam Sandler film!

choice1: This movie passed the Bechdel test! Let's celebrate by watching one that will be a slam-dunk on that test!
choice2: Sometimes thieving pays off big, but sometimes it ends in humiliation...
choice3: How much are flights to Algeria?

choice1: It's all fun and games until someone ends up with a plate in her head
choice2: Aside from the war footage, at least no one actually exploded in the end!
choice3: Those gals recovered nicely from losing their limbs. Sadly, that wouldn't happen in real life.

choice1: Not sure what lessons I'm supposed to take away from this. Maybe Robert S. Macnamara can tell me!
choice2: I can appreciate a man who knows how to apply makeup!
choice3: Straighter and less Oedipal, please!

choice1: Pomegranates are tasty, but what I really like to eat is flowers!
choice2: Did Lady Gaga ever do any videos based on the style and fashion of the Babadook?
choice3: Gotta say the percussion in this was kinda rad...

choice1: This was fine, but my musical tastes are a little more Cab Calloway...
choice2: Japanese culture is also pretty fascinating...to a point!
choice3: If we ruin the environment through climate change, everyone is going to find themselves doing a lot of Roma-like migration...

choice1: I hate the way you make poor travel decisions...
choice2: I hate the way you act just like my deceased father sometimes...
choice3: And I hate that you won't just shut up and be pretty!

choice1: Cher had a pretty strong moral code and she meant well, even if it got her in trouble sometimes.
choice2: Giving Brittany Murphy a glow-up isn't exactly as difficult as towing a steamship over the Andes!
choice3: I wonder what Jodorowsky's "Emma" would look like...

choice1: I think I need to watch something a little more gangsta than this next.
choice2: Those two were a cute couple, but they're no match for Sophia Loren and Marcello Mastroianni
choice3: Okay this was artsy and all, but I'm ready for some cartoon titties.

choice1: I would love to see Klaus Kinski liberate those camps with an army of amazon women!
choice2: Holocaust documentaries always put me in the mood to watch a Talking Heads concert!
choice3: Okay, I need something less depressing. Let's punch the whimsical button really hard and see something animated that was directed by Wes Anderson!

choice1: Neo-noir is not my cup of tea. Got anything written by Jane Austen?
choice2: Show me more films about thieves!
choice3: That David Bowie song made me nostalgic...let's check in on the 1980s punk scene!

choice1: Is stealing a car against the rules of the game?
choice2: The bear was nice. Are there lions and tigers too?
choice3: Another good rule of the game: it should not be your custom to go where you are not invited!

choice1: All the angels in the world aren't going to save us if we screw up the environment!
choice2: Let's check back in on that Antione Doinel fuckup. I can't imagine his guardian angel hasn't ragequit by now...
choice3: Brittany Murphy had the face of an angel...

choice1: No one likes a rat!
choice2: Lower stakes, please. So is that poor Antoine Doinel kid doing well with the ladies?

choice1: At least they weren't dumb enough to film their own crimes!
choice2: Love the Mark Mothersbaugh score. A catchy song or two can make or break a film!
choice3: That Dignan was a good strategist, but he's got nothing on that Khan Noonien Singh fellow!

choice1: I do love a good coming of age story!
choice2: Young people need healthier hobbies than mopeds and drugs. Why not try wrestling or ice skating?
choice3: Sometimes it's better to keep troublesome teenagers close to home so they stay out of trouble!

choice1: That was intense and sad. Can we get a love story next?
choice2: Okay, so what's the vulpine equivalent of Alain Delon? I imagine George Clooney would do his voice...
choice3: OAS terrorists are pretty bad, but off-Wall Street finance bros are just rage-inducing...

choice1: Travel is broadening and is a good way to meet new people, even if you're cranky about it.
choice2: An angry god would not approve of these close female friendships!
choice3: Female friendship is great...but what I really want to see is Ray Winstone's dick!

choice1: Well that was depressing. More depressing, please!
choice2: So do young women still have it that rough?
choice3: I'd rather see Anna Karina in something more flattering than a nun's habit...

choice1: Celine and Julie would make great detectives!
choice2: This was just the right amount of twee for me. Now I'm in the mood for some Wes Anderson!
choice3: Sometimes breaking into a house like that can have tragic consequences...

choice1: Someone should set that Boojum letter to music...
choice2: At least none of those co-conspirators blabbed to the cops.
choice3: In the time it took to watch that I could have watched like four hockey games!

choice1: Enough girls in the nude, lets get some boys in the hood!
choice2: That was surprisingly boring. This may sound like a weird request, but...less nudity, more watersports!
choice3: I'm going to need a lot of nun action to recover from all that full frontal nudity.

choice1: I like this French New Wave stuff. Can I get a sample pack to go please?
choice2: That love wasn't THAT crazy. Show me a movie where someone fucks a car!
choice3: ...or something with some sibling-on-sibling shoulder licking!

choice1: Constantly having to pick the next film is stressful.
choice2: Can you pick the next one for me?
choice3: I promise I won't complain!

choice1: I just watched a woman silently do chores for three hours. I think I have the attention span to watch an hour of burning Gulf War oil fields, mostly without comment...
choice2: So is it better for your mental health to hold in your emotions and let them all come out at once, or to express them frequently and dramatically?
choice3: Needs more toesucking.

choice1: That family was pretty crazy. Throw in a talking cat and you'd have the makings of a great sitcom!
choice2: The Dad in this looks like he'd be a good film director. I wonder what his first full-length film would look like...
choice3: Those people were kinda trashy. Show me someone with a little more wealth and taste!

choice1: Wes Anderson is a pretty strong flavor. Let's do some Tarantino next for a change of pace.
choice2: At least Margot Tenenbaum wasn't putting cigarettes out on people's wrists!
choice3: It sucks when parents fail to set a good example for their children...

choice1: Perusing the want ads seems like a good way to run across conspiracies and conspiracy theorists...
choice2: Madonna is just a material girl. Now Peter Falk...that guy is a true angel!
choice3: Not bad, but needs more slapstick!

choice1: That beret would look great on a Tokyo drag queen...
choice2: I love a good coming of age story!
choice3: Fast talking can get you out of a lot of jams, and you could do worse than having Bill Murray as a mentor!

choice1: It didn't seem like a good idea having that guy in charge of things, but I guess it worked out in the end!
choice2: Piracy on the high seas really is a menace to society...
choice3: I wonder if Wes Anderson's quirks can be traced to some seminal film that greatly influenced him!

choice1: Are there any trains that run to the Cool World?
choice2: Remember that if you start to overdose on Wes Anderson, you can always come down with some John Waters!
choice3: At least none of those brothers got framed for a crime they didn't commit!

choice1: A woman is a woman even if she has hot dog fingers.
choice2: Is a woman still a woman if she's a married woman?
choice3: Meh, needs more watersports.

choice1: Shorter and grittier, please!
choice2: That hotel looks like it would be a good weekend getaway...
choice3: At least if it hasn't been totally invaded by yuppie scum!

choice1: That scene with the wolf in the moonlight made the moon look like a nice place to visit.
choice2: Wes Anderson doing Roald Dahl is pretty tame. What happens if you let Jodorowsky have a crack at Frank Herbert?
choice3: This was fine, but I'm more into old-school animation...

choice1: Lots of toxic masculinity here. Got anything with a literal dick-measuring contest?
choice2: Dirty cops are kind of my jam. Got any more of the same, but set in New Orleans?
choice3: Got anything equally long but less action-packed?

choice1: Two guys and a girl would make a great band, but they'd probably make the girl play bass...
choice2: Spending three hours watching someone paint a single painting makes me understand why someone might prefer doing a speed-run of The Louvre...
choice3: Weirdly enough, I'm in the mood for a good baseball movie after this!

choice1: How ya gonna keep up down in Muncie after they've seen Paris?
choice2: I'll never understand dudes who like aviation more than women...
choice3: A married woman is no match for a strong enough man!

choice1: What kind of parents raise a girl who ends up getting mixed wup with gun smugglers?
choice2: More French New Wave please...but shorter!
choice3: Bet they'd have gotten off easier if they had stuck to white collar crime!

choice1: Staying quiet is actually pretty important if you're secretly living in someone's house!
choice2: Shut up and be pretty, or be loud and learn kung-fu!
choice3: Nobody ever told Joan of Arc to shut up and be pretty...

choice1: A good scout never performs illegal surgeries!
choice2: Glad suzy didn't just shut up and be pretty like her parents wanted.
choice3: That Francoise Hardy record put me in the mood for some French New Wave!

choice1: MAKE IT!
choice2: MAKE IT!
choice3: DON'T FAKE IT!

choice1: If you're a woman with some time to kill while you're waiting on something, don't waste it flirting with a serial killer!
choice2: So what happens if you choose the bear instead of the man?
choice3: I wonder how this would be as a Sweeney Todd-type musical...

choice1: All the creepy virus-y sex in this made my skin crawl. Definitely not following this up with anything by Cronenberg. Maybe something nice and dumb with racecars...
choice2: Teenagers are terrible. It would be nice if a parent could just hit fast-forward and skip the awkward years!
choice3: The 1990s HIV paranoia makes this squirmy enough. Imagine how bad it would be with fast-acting body horror parasites instead of AIDS...

choice1: Too tense for me. Something with a "Limousine Ride to a Haircut" sounds more my speed.
choice2: Or maybe a Rocket to the Moon would be more ambitious and inspirational.
choice3: It's all fun and games until someone finds the dead bodies and/or photographic evidence you carelessly left laying around!

choice1: I love the black-and-white retro feel of this!
choice2: Actually, I'd love to see something more colorful and Armenian...
choice3: Actually, show me an invasion of possibly-benevolent aliens instead. I have some survey questions I'd love to ask them about current events!

choice1: Okay, I'm straight now. Back to unsatisfactory heterosexual relationships!
choice2: I heard having a good blue-collar working man role model in one's childhood does wonders for keeping away the gay!
choice3: Watching some early French New Wave shorts is a good way to figure out gender-appropriate ways of behaving!

choice1: That was...a bit abstract. Could we maybe see a meat-and-potatoes story about some historical figure instead?
choice2: It would be interesting seeing Norman Mailer try to play Russian faith healer Vissarion...
choice3: I was hoping for more outrageous fashion stuff from a film made in the late 1980s...

choice1: Some people think Godard jumped the shark with this one...
choice2: Being a prostitute as your fun-money side hustle while your husband is at work seems like a sure way to pick up a blood-borne illness!
choice3: Sometimes people can get so trapped in their gender roles it can feel like a concentration camp!

choice1: If you're going to kill your parents as part of some harebrained scheme to get your hands on their money, at least do it by accident!
choice2: I wonder how the traffic is in the Florida panhandle this time of year...
choice3: Cannibalism is a bit much. Doesn't anyone just do plain old vampirism anymore?

choice1: Whether we're talking music or meat, it's always interesting seeing how the sausage is made!
choice2: I think a Rolling Stones documentary now would probably be just a bunch of senior citizens humping trash.
choice3: Mick Jagger is charismatic, but he's no Vissarion!

choice1: It's all fun and games until someone loses an eye!
choice2: Impulsive man-child with big dreams? Someone give that man a moped!
choice3: Poor anger management is a good way to end up locked away in a mental hospital.

choice1: Jane Fonda seemed a bit stressed there after her experiences covering that strike...
choice2: Wildcat strikes are a gateway drug to sabotage and eco-terrorism!
choice3: At least it was a sausage factory and not a pet cemetery!

choice1: The factory sounds from the start of this movie are a treat for the ears. I wonder what a slaughterhouse would sound like...
choice2: Love the chaotic parts. Got anything with really messy eaters?
choice3: After watching this, I'm convinced that the Dahomey Amazons would benefit from having a labor union!

choice1: So did the paratroopers in Algeria ever jump out of blimps?
choice2: This had so much potential for slapstick hijinks but never delivered
choice3: Okay, the OAS suck, but they got nothing on the Khmer Rouge...

choice1: It's always heartwarming to see two creepy French idiots somehow manage to be a hit with the ladies!
choice2: Forget the Army, just join a hockey team instead!
choice3: If you're an unskilled young person, there are two places always willing to hire fuckups and train them up to do something slightly better: the Army and fledgling punk rock bands!

choice1: Those young punks could use some discipline...bet the army would sort them out!
choice2: Wonder what the distance record is for the longest stage-dive?
choice3: Wisconsin seems like a pretty good place to travel to watch the decline of western civilization up close!

choice1: That Germs burn thing would be a great idea for cult initiation!
choice2: You know what's really punk? British imperialism! (Okay, I guess that's not very punk at all but that's what's next!)
choice3: Love the Germs logo. Nice and round--reminds me a bit of a mandala...

choice1: I do love films with a strong young lady as protagonist!

choice3: Travel seems like a pain and inconvenience. They could have avoided a lot of this mess if they had just stayed in Paris.

choice1: Needs more madrigals.
choice2: It's nice seeing a man pursue something he's passionate about, whether it's a girl or a shark!
choice3: Maybe Antoine should have written Colette a fan letter...

choice1: Maybe those punks would have fared better in Wisconsin!
choice2: Those stray dogs looked pretty ragged. Wonder what their story is...

choice1: I think God would be angry at the boorishness of most of these slackers and backsliders!
choice2: Probably better off dying in a volcano than on the roof of a convenience store...
choice3: Those young men need to come up with a solid plan for breaking out of their rut and making it big!

choice1: An ankle bracelet is the ultimate punk accessory!
choice2: Kids like Eugene who are good at mechanics and sneaking around would be great in the Army!
choice3: Better being housebound than being stuck in traffic for ages and ages!

choice1: This didn't do it for me. Maybe a rockumentary would be more my speed...
choice2: Living near family members can be stressful, especially when your neighbors are also weirdos!
choice3: Got anything else by Chabrol? Preferably with some serial murders...

choice1: It's a bit inspiring to see someone stick to their ideals, even if it doesn't personally go well for them!

choice3: Well, we found out what Boethius would think about the Madchester scene, but what about Ludwig Wittgenstein?

choice1: Why would those women settle for hanging out with those two childish dopes and a killer when they could be hooking up with Alain Delon?
choice2: Better off working in an appliance store than a sausage factory!
choice3: Hopefully none of those women will be pushing a baby carriage any time soon...especially down the Odessa Steps!

choice1: When I saw Belle and Sebastian were involved, I got excited. but not a Saint Bernard in sight. Got anything with actual dogs?
choice2: Indie Rock is fine, but I still prefer the Stones.
choice3: That main dweeb reminded me of someone. Maybe one of those IBM whiz kids...

choice1: Enough showgirls. I want something short, German, and weird.
choice2: Hope that poor neighbor girl doesn't get put into juvie after running away, or we could have the makings of an Antoinette Doinel!
choice3: Some cannibal aliens would really spice this film up!

choice1: So where does Last Tango in Paris fit in with the Antoine Doinel films? Is it before or after this one?
choice2: All these films set in Paris are great, but what's the deal with that big TV tower thing we keep seeing in the background?
choice3: Alright, Truffaut is honestly pretty charming. What did he think of Hitchcock?

choice1: I bet Antoine Doinel would be uniquely bad as a police officer...
choice2: What have we learned here? Well, probably not as much as we could have learned from the Vietnam War...
choice3: I can't believe Antoine Doinel still has both his eyes and all of his fingers after all the trouble he manages to get into on the job and off!

choice1: Enough smoke aliens, show me some quirky animated foxes!
choice2: Using mahjong with those aliens was dangerous enough. Wonder how badly things would have gone if they would have taught them Monopoly...
choice3: Pretty sad to know your kid won't make it to their thirteenth birthday. Just goes to show what an ambitious leap of faith Linklater made with his child actors...

choice1: Those capitalist pigs will be the first against the wall when the revolution comes!
choice2: Jonah Hill's character marrying his cousin sounds like kind of a bad idea...but I know cousins can be pretty close sometimes.
choice3: After such a dramatic crash, someone needs to go back and sort through the wreckage.

choice1: Sometimes it's nice to catch up with someone from your past, especially if they're up for getting a milkshake or going bowling!
choice2: You know, this kind of reminds me of that Star Trek TNG episode "Shades of Gray" where Riker gets infected by the alien parasite and the only way to save him is to force him to relive his memories in the form of clips from earlier episodes!
choice3: This would make a great children's book! (Or at least you could do worse...)

choice1: Glad to see Tre get the condom talk from his dad. Not a good idea to go carelessly knocking women up!
choice2: Got anything else with a kid being shot for stupid reasons?
choice3: Why do a drive-by when you can go turkey hunting instead?

choice1: Please tell me that kid doesn't just end up back in his hometown standing around the convenience store parking lot after he graduates...
choice2: Patricia Arquette looked pretty frazzled. Bet she could have used a few sips of sedative-spiked gazpacho...
choice3: Linklater should know it's all fun and games until they grow up and discover drugs and turn into slackers...

choice1: They shot a lot more than just piano players in the Holocaust...
choice2: This was very...atmospheric. I can see why someone might be attracted to the dark glow of the mountains, or even the streetlights...
choice3: Shooting the piano player seems a step too far. Could we maybe just bully the violinist instead?

choice1: Nicely done. This calls for a celebration in the form of weirdly staged Jacques Brel songs!
choice2: They should have been using that radio station to broadcast Maoist propaganda!
choice3: They did a good job fending off a siege of demented Canadians. I wonder how they'd do against an invasion of Brad Dourif aliens...

choice1: "Que heavy eres, Ludwig!"
choice2: I bet Cher Horowitz would have some glib answers to some of the questions posed by Wittgenstein!
choice3: All this philosophizing really makes me want a bagel.

choice1: Keep eating a corn syrup heavy diet, David, and eventually you'll fit into that suit!
choice2: "Psycho Killer, qu'est-ce que c'est?"
choice3: So were all those roadies and stagehands unionized?

choice1: Welp, that was uplifting. Maybe we could watch something a little more kid-friendly instead?
choice2: I need something different. German is fine, but maybe shorter and a little more uplifting?
choice3: Seeing them move those rocks back and forth is a good reminder that endless tidying for others can be bad for your mental health.

choice1: Welp. At least there was no actual cannibalism.
choice2: That "butter" scene was kind of intense. I wonder what that was like to film...
choice3: I bet Brando's character could have used some sort of theatrical grievance counseling to cope with his wife's death...

choice1: Lots of bad blood on that film set.
choice2: I'd rather be trapped in an elevator than stuck in a room with Brando and Bertolucci.
choice3: Let's keep up the theme of bad things happening to bisexual young women...

choice1: Can faith healers cure gangrene?
choice2: Drinking poison seemed a bit dramatic. Couldn't she just have joined a nunnery?
choice3: Setting off fireworks can be good stress relief too!

choice1: Nice seeing how everyone on a film set has a specialty, and if things go according to plan everything pays off like a lucrative jewel heist!
choice2: I'd love to take a look behind the scenes at a fancy hotel next!
choice3: I bet there's plenty of drama to be seen if you take a close look at fancy private schools as well...

choice1: Soap opera plots can get pretty crazy. But sometimes eighteenth century literature can be even crazier!
choice2: Nothing like a sword or knife attack on a relative by an unhinged person to liven up a plotline!
choice3: Elisabeth Shue's character grew up pretty well-adjusted despite having an absent mother. I'm sure some other families don't fare that well...

choice1: The pervert sex maniac brother was a pretty extreme example, but it's pretty common to have difficult siblings...
choice2: Sometimes it's good to peek in on what other people are doing, but maybe it's best not to get too involved...
choice3: As weird as it is, this movie is so colorful and visually stimulating. More along those lines, please!

choice1: If I were that kid's parent, I'd go into hibernation and see if she grew out of that obnoxiousness!
choice2: It's all fun and games when most of the city loses their minds and hijinks ensue--until they start babbling nonsense and vomiting blood!
choice3: Nice to see a young lady having fun running around the streets of Paris!

choice1: "I hate the way you crawl out of sewers, and the way you cut your hair. I hate when you bite people's fingers off and make everybody stare!"
choice2: Those limousines are symbols of western decadence, and they'll be the first against the wall when the revolution comes!
choice3: Seeing someone act as a one-man guerrilla theater company is pretty inspiring. Maybe I should start my own band!

choice1: I'm actually really glad Klaus Kinski was not in this movie...
choice2: Watching that kid for three hours was not easy on the eyes. Time for some Alain Delon!
choice3: Enough uncomfortable sex scenes with young actors! Let's watch something wholesome, maybe with some music and dancing!

choice1: Pepa's husband was kind of a shithead. Speaking of which, let's check back in on what Antoine Doinel is doing!
choice2: The car and motorcycle chase at the end of this gives me the need for speed!
choice3: Nervous breakdowns and love affairs can probably complicate film productions in unexpected and unpleasant ways...

choice1: Antonio Banderas has the face of an angel...but he's no Peter Falk!
choice2: It would be nice to have a maid for those times that you're too tied up to do any tidying!
choice3: This was a bit too slow-paced and contemplative for my taste. Got anything with a little more zip?

choice1: Sometimes when people accidentally kill relatives they don't get off nearly so easy though...
choice2: I hope the grandma and the dope-slinging son have a happier life in a rural setting!
choice3: I have a feeling God would be angry at a lot of the things that went on in this film!

choice1: The dick-measuring contest in this taught me that everyone across the political spectrum, from leftist punks to Nazis, appreciates a big strong virile man!
choice2: Were all of Almodovar's early films this weird?
choice3: Really loved the fashion in this movie, but what those girls really needed were some quality footwear!

choice1: That was somehow...very German. Got anything more Armenian-flavored?
choice2: Making a film can be pretty stressful on people's relationships.
choice3: But a DIY project with friends who share similar niche interests, can lead to a good time for all!
